text: Calcium carbonate, CaCO3, decomposes upon heating to calcium oxide and carbon dioxide. What mass of solid calcium carbonate is required to produce 2.40 liters of carbon dioxide measured at STP?

text: When this solution is treated with aqueous hydrochloric acid, a precipitate forms. What is the precipitate?

text: Which statement about atoms arranged in a body- centered cubic (bcc) crystal structure is correct?

options.A: It is not observed as the structure of any metallic elements.
options.B: It is also called the cubic closest-packed (ccp) structure.
options.C: The unit cell contains two atoms.

text: A system consists of a gas contained in a thin balloon. If the balloon deflates as the temperature of the gas changes from 90 ºC to 25 ºC, then

options.A: Heat is transferred out of the system and work is done on the system.
options.B: Heat is transferred out of the system and work is done by the system.
options.C: Heat is transferred into the system and work is done on the system.
options.D: Heat is transferred into the system and work is done by the system.

text: When 20.15 g MgO is decomposed at constant pressure according to the equation below, how much heat will be transferred? 2 MgO(s)  2 Mg(s) + O2(g)
Which halogen has the highest standard entropy, Sº?

options.D: ∆Hº > 0 and no conclusion may be drawn about the sign of ∆Sº

text: For the reaction 2 H2(g) + 2 NO(g)  N2(g) + 2 H2O(g) the rate law is rate = k[H2][NO](2). At a given temperature, what is the effect on the reaction rate if the concentration of H2 is doubled and the concentration of NO is halved?

Which of the following are reasons why reaction rates increase as temperature increases? I. Collisions are more frequent between molecules at higher temperatures. II. A greater fraction of collisions have sufficient energy to exceed Ea at higher temperatures. III. Reactant concentrations are higher at higher temperatures.
What is the effect of adding a catalyst on the rate of a reversible reaction in the forward and the reverse direction?

options.A: It has no effect on the rate in either direction.
options.B: Both rates increase by the same factor.
options.C: The rate in the forward direction increases by a greater factor than the rate in the reverse direction.
options.D: The rate in the reverse direction increases by a greater factor than the rate in the forward direction.

Lithium ion batteries are now commonly used in rechargeable consumer electronic devices. The main reason lithium is used in these devices is because

options.A: lithium has a lower electronegativity than nickel in common nickel-cadmium batteries.
options.B: lithium batteries are not as toxic as common alkaline batteries.
options.C: lithium batteries have a reduced risk of leakage of chemicals.
options.D: lithium batteries achieve a greater amount of energy stored per unit mass than other common batteries.

options.C: the fact that the electron ionized in N is from the 2s subshell, while that ionized from O is from the 2p subshell.
options.D: the fact that N has an odd number of electrons while O has an even number.
